Mitre 10 (New Zealand) Limited - we have been a part of New Zealand's home improvement culture since 1974. An award-winning success story, we delight our customers with our home improvement, garden and trade offer.
We’re set to transform both our business and our IT team and are on the lookout for someone to take on this awesome opportunity as Senior DevOps Engineer based at our Albany Support Centre.
This role will see the successful candidate take responsibility for the design, build, implementation, and support of information technology platforms with the aim of continuous improvement. You'll provide production support for end users, technical support where required and ensures quality platforms, reliable information, and stable applications.
Reporting to the Technical Lead – Cloud, you’ll be responsible for but not limited to: -
Working with Project Managers, Development Technical Leads and Architects to design, build and deliver well architected and secure infrastructure
Ensuring solutions to be concise with easy-to-follow structure, following dev-ops best practices, and conforming to Mitre 10 development and operation standards
Proactively recommend initiatives that continuously improve Information Technology Services policies, systems, solutions, and practices
Provide mentoring and guidance around infrastructure as a service, cloud architecture and best practices to other team members
Participate in the Mitre 10 on-call roster as level two and three support.
To be successful in this role, we are looking for someone with; -
Solid IT experience (8+ years) including 2+ years in architecture
Experience within environments that offer a mix of Agile and waterfall methodologies
Advanced knowledge of Web Technologies, Full Stack Development, Rest Webservices, OWASP guidelines, Bamboo, Git and other development tools and productivity tools
Strong experience and knowledge of AWS and Azure cloud infrastructure is desired
Working knowledge of scripting languages such as BASH, Python, Ruby, PowerShell
Strong grasp of networking, security, and reliability fundamentals
Experience and a fundamental understanding of CICD practices and Agile methodologies
Experience with Infrastructure as Code technologies such as BOSH, Terraform and CloudFormation
This role offers the opportunity to work on Auckland’s North Shore in a positive, fast paced environment that is stimulating and enjoyable to work in. We are a team moving forward and that is a result of our motivated, skilled team members. There is an attractive remuneration package for this role, generous staff buying privileges, life insurance, discounted medical insurance, birthday day off, flexible working and more.
If you are a highly motivated individual who is passionate about being part of the Mitre 10 team and a company in growth mode, then we want to hear from you. Please provide your CV and cover letter, including your remuneration expectations, via this website.
Please note that recruitment will be on Christmas leave from the 23rd of December until the 12 of January and, therefore, we will only be reviewing and contacting candidates in the New Year. We’re united by our love of technology and its potential for making lives better. Some of us are big picture thinkers, some of us creatively driven. And some of us love nothing more than deep diving into a thorny technical challenge. But we’re all human, inspired by human stories and driven by a desire to create human-centred experiences.
Love making things for people to enjoy? Join the team designing the technology that matters.
About the role:
As part of our R-Vision team, you'll be working on our in-house product on the cutting edge of computer vision technology - where your role will be focused on backend programming, ML Ops, CI/CD pipelines.
We are currently on the lookout for talented, ambitious, intermediate/senior level backend engineers. You’ll be working on a cutting edge innovation stream of work that links up computer vision based technology and potentially other sensors with an amazingly fun and innovative product within the Health and Safety space!

On the daily, you'll be:Responsible for designing, developing and deploying vision systems that are either cloud based or embedded. Experience using various cloud vendors for large scale projects will come in handy.Collaborating and working closely with the rest of the team, especially the junior developers to knowledge share and help with upskilling.Proactively communicating progress during meetings, raising issues when appropriate and thoroughly documenting the approach taken along with results at every step of the project.Highly motivated and interested in staying up to date with the latest research in the field, attending meetups and conferences and sharing learnings and best practices with the rest of the team.
About you:
You'll ideally have a passion for ML/ AI space, with experience in as much of the following as possible:Excellent communication skills.Strong demonstrated skills in architecture of backend applications, ability to get involved in backend development from scratch enforcing best practice.3+ years experience in PythonYou dig agile development and can show your experience with the whole software dev life-cycle. You’re a start-to-finish kinda kid.Experience with DL/ML cloud platforms Microsoft Azure, AWS, Tensorflow.A reasonable opinion to share recommendations and alternatives objectively. Plus, it helps when deciding where to go for lunch.
- You’re effective by nature - you like to move fast, you like prototyping, and you love validating and being thorough in all aspects of your day-to-day job.
Ability to understand, implement and critique the latest research as well as a passion for staying on top of cutting edge innovations in the world of tech.
Documentation and communication (in-person, email, slack, carrier pigeon if need be) doesn’t scare you.
Bonus skills
Basic understanding of front-end dev: Angular 2+ or React JS or Vue JS
Experience with Docker and Kubernetes
What matters to us?
Put people first - It's about the people, not the tech.
Push the boundaries - Who wants to do what's been done already?
Play the long game - We create sustainable solutions, not quick fixes.
Say it like it is - Life's too short for miscommunication.

Company Description
TheMarket.com is a curated lifestyle shopping platform which launched in August 2019, backed by The Warehouse Group. With over 850 merchants representing 8,000+ brands and 7m+ SKUs, we aim to become one of the biggest marketplaces in New Zealand. This amazing once-in-a-lifetime opportunity exists to help bring this goal to life.
At TheMarket, we are passionate about the brands and merchants that we work with, selecting authentic alignments to tell great stories via our various marketing channels. Whether it’s search, display, affiliates, retargeting or social; targeting awareness, consideration or purchase intents; on mobile, app, desktop or tablet - we strive to create always on-brand and engaging marketing communications for all our personas.
Learn more about TheMarket from its CEO, Justus Wilde in the following video.

Job Description
We're looking for an Dev-Ops Engineer with a willingness to learn and work as part of a team, and to bring a good practical engineering approach to working with cloud-hosted infrastructure and DevOps.
This role will be within our CORE Engineering Team, you will be responsible for working against any technology duties associated with Dev-Ops and infrastructure. Including but not limited to, designing, building, implementation, maintenance, monitoring, continuous improvement, and support of all infrastructure environments.
As a member of the CORE Engineering Team, you will play a crucial role and work closely with the Solution Architects, Principal Engineer, Software Developers to ensure all solutions are secure, robust, cost optimised, and fit for purpose. Crucial to this role will be your ability to work collaboratively with the team and provide mentorship and leadership on Dev-Ops related tasks.
Key Concepts and Responsibilities cover:
Agile Software Development - a thorough understanding of agile methodologies and workflows is important.
Spec-first Design - being part of the design phase to address operational, security and monitoring impacts and needs ahead of time.
Developer Experience - understanding development lifecycle pain points and advising on how we can address them is key.
Multi-tenanted System
Micro-services Architecture - understanding how to effectively design, build, configure, deploy, test, and monitor distributed systems where components can be released independently and confidently.
Event-driven Architecture
Relational and Non-Relational Data
Ability to implement new, Continuous Integration, Delivery and Deployment
Ability to implement new monitoring tools
Configuration Management
Observability
Incident Response Management
Security

Qualifications

Understanding of the following languages and frameworks: Linux, Python (Poetry), Javascript (Node.js), Angular, Vue.js, Mocha
Experience with design and implementation of redundant, fault tolerant and scalable system
Worked with Github(or similar) setting up pipelines
Achieving observability through ElasticSearch and Kibana
Proven skills in solving business problems.
Excellent communication (written and verbal) and collaboration skills
Prior team leadership role
Ability to work with and influence stakeholders to complete agreed tasks
Ability to deliver solutions and artifacts within given timeframes and available resources
Confident in giving technical advice, mentoring, and coaching
In-deep analytical skills and the ability to see the connections between layers of a business are connected and how business processes achieve their goals
You’re a true team player who knows that we all have to sometimes roll up our sleeves
Additional Information
Why work for us?
Warehouse Group discount card (including Noel Leeming, Torpedo7, 1-Day deals, and 15% off at The Warehouse and Warehouse Stationery)
A paid day off on your birthday
Career progression – a great steppingstone into e-commerce the fastest growing market in the world
Wellness and discretionary leave
Work within an agile team developing new exciting features in e-commerce, driving convenience for millions of kiwi shoppers
Be a part of a supportive team, who are invested in the each other succeeding
Be encouraged to grow and take on more responsibilities to improve and advance in your career path
Get dedicated time and training resources for professional development, and support to grow in your areas of interest
Work from home two to three days a week with flexible hours
Our company culture is laid back but energised with a group of innovative and driven people that are focused on creating the next frontier for retail in New Zealand.
Click here to check out more of our benefits
The right type of person for this role
You thrive on coupling creativity with execution.
You’re a natural collaborator.
Pragmatic straight shooter that will thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment

ABOUT TRA & STREAMLIGHT
TRA is an award-winning insight agency in New Zealand and Australia intent on solving the complex problems organisations face today. Combining our understanding of human behaviour with intelligent data capability, we put people at the heart of the organisations we work with.
Streamlight is TRA’s new-world brand tracking tool. A real-time brand tracking program, combining leading-edge technology with TRA’s expert consulting team, frameworks and thinking, to build better brands.
We’re launching Streamlight to the market and looking for a Full Stack Developer based in Bangalore, India, to join us for 3 months and lead the tech development of the platform.
ABOUT THE ROLE
A pivotal role in bringing Streamlight to life, this exciting new role will see you develop, maintain and architect Streamlight’s end-to-end systems, from delivering an initial concept and MVP to building version one and beyond into a scalable product.
Working collaboratively with a full product team (product owner, UI designers and data engineers) you will lead the technical development of the platform, getting involved in all aspects of product and feature development, from scoping and design, to building and maintaining.
Working in an agile environment with sprint-based prioritisation of key milestones, you will contribute to the building of the product roadmap and lead the implementation of delivery. At all stages considering the value delivered to users, the speed of iteration, and scalability of the platform.
Requirements
ABOUT YOU
We’re looking for someone with:
3 – 5 years’ experience as a full stack developer, or equivalent experience in a mix of back and front-end development.
Reasonable on the job experience working with a variety of AWS services (i.e. Amplify, API Gateway, RDS, Cloudfront, EC2, Lambda).
Experience with the following stack:
o Vue, Angular and/or React
o HTML/JS/CSS
o SQL (ideally either MySQL or Postgres).
Experience with CI/CD or dev-ops tools and concepts.
A restless desire to move fast and break things, and a desire to see change and disruption.
A hacker mindset to develop something cool using available tools quickly with minimal effort and maximum effect.
An obsession with the user and a desire to see things through their eyes.
The ability to work in a fast-paced environment and adept at balancing urgent tasks with longer-term priorities.
Benefits

TRA are Winners of Best Innovation Programme at the 2018, 2020 and 2021 AFR Boss Most Innovative Company awards, we are an agency challenging the status quo and influencing decisions. In joining Streamlight you’re backed by world-class expertise in marketing, branding and innovation.
We are a curious, creative, and multi-disciplinary team committed to delivering amazing work built on our values of collaboration, creativity, and clarity.
We will take your career to the next level, with amazing on-the-job learning experiences and a strong and structured development environment.
We have a supportive and inclusive environment, and we love to have fun together. From regular social events to our weekly sharing sessions, we relish a good opportunity to celebrate who we are and what we do.
How you work, where you work, and when you work is in your hands. TRA Flex is just one more way we challenge the status quo. If you would like to join a diverse group of thinkers and adopt a flexible approach to work-life balance, this is the place for you.

You will be supported not only by our team based in New Zealand, but two of our amazing developers based in Bangalore under TRA Business Group.
And of course, the competitive salary package underpins the experience.

We want to hear from the driven, the motivated, the curious, and the creative. Hit the apply now button!

listing_jobDesc:
Senior Software Engineer - Testing Chapter - Financial Crime
Support applications used by Financial Crime Operations
Get hands-on with interesting & complex pieces of work on an enterprise scale
Flexible working options, development opportunities and banking benefits!
At ASB, we're all about doing what we can to help our customers get "One Step Ahead" by giving them the tools they need to manage their lives and plans for their families and future. Our products don't just serve ads or stream movies - they underpin our economy and touch people's lives.
If you've always wanted to apply your skills to a large-scale Kiwi success story, then today is your lucky day - as we are on the lookout for a Senior Test Engineer to join us in our Sanctions Squad.
About the role:
Sanctions squad implement, configure, maintain, and support the applications used by Financial Crime Operations to make sure ASB complies with national and international regulations regarding sanctions.
As a Senior Test Engineer in Sanctions squad, you'll be part of our team that helps keep our customers safe. Being part of the Engineering Practice at ASB we encourage our teams to work autonomously in an agile way while actively growing their skills and expertise to continuously improve outcomes for our customers.
You'll have the opportunity to get hands-on with some interesting and complex pieces of work that integrate on an enterprise scale, all while being part of a smaller squad that makes their own decisions about how to work through prioritisation - so your voice will be heard, and your opinions valued.
We advocate agile, fully cross functional teams which will take you through all facets of engineering in any given day. We are looking for a mix of technical skills to support the following activities:
Reviewing requirements and specifications
Coming up with agile testing strategies and plans
Verifying and validating functionality being developed
Writing automated tests or extend on an existing one.
Analysing and reporting test results
Working with key stakeholders for testing end to end
About you:
We are looking for an individual that will take ownership for the testing of our technical solutions, drive continuous change for the squad and customers to ensure we are delivering best possible outcomes. You will work collaboratively with our squads and stakeholders to be the voice of engineering and deliver products that delight our customers.
We are looking for someone who has:
5+ years of sound software test engineering experience, preferably in an enterprise environment.
Proven knowledge across functional, system, integration and end to end testing
Produce/contribute/maintain test artefacts
Working knowledge of MSSQL and Oracle SQL
API Test automation experience using Postman or similar tool
Good understanding and experience of working using Agile principles
Your proven initiative, problem solving abilities and technical leadership will make you well suited to this role.
In addition, the following would be an advantage:
Certified in ISTQB Fundamentals
Working knowledge of performance testing
Worked in supporting financial services systems.
Exposure to Azure Dev Ops CI/CD
Working at ASB:
ASB's sense of who we are and what we stand for is grounded in our values. They guide our business in our day-to-day interactions with our team, customers, and community. They are what makes ASB - ASB.
Along with our interactions, values guide our actions and conduct, making ASB a safe and inclusive environment for both our people and our customers. They show that we care, are passionate and courageous, and that we act with integrity. Most importantly they unite us - because they are ASB.
We offer a flexible and supportive work environment and offer an open and inclusive culture; a place where we welcome and value your individuality, ideas, and goals.
If we've nailed our pitch and this role sounds like it might be the one for you then please click "apply"… we'd love to hear from you!
To be considered, all applications need to be via our on-line career channels and will be treated with confidentiality. Applications close 11pm on September 4th. Applications will be reviewed prior to this date.

Newly Created Role
Build an Inhouse IT Test Practise
Mix of Strategic and "Hands-On" activities

This is an exciting, rare opportunity for a skilled and knowledgeable Testing Professional to establish an IT Test and release practice covering all areas of IT.
It will appeal to a “Doer”, someone who still likes to get their hands dirty doing different aspects of Testing but who wants to have more holistic, strategic input into how Testing can contribute to a successful IT environment.

THE ROLE
It’s about putting in place industry best practice for IT Testing but at the same time ensuring the Testing approach is applicable and appropriate for business environment. One that compliments, supports and adds value to the successful delivery of IT to the business.
The role is responsible for ensuring there is a single overview and a consistent approach taken for Testing of IT related projects and activities. A Test Strategy is developed and regularly maintained, that associated processes and systems are implemented and consistently followed. That all IT system enhancements, upgrades and implementations are fully tested and comply with user functional expectations and corporate standards prior to release.
Testing is an accepted concept within clients IT environment and is regularly used on a project basis but has predominantly been provided via an outsourced model. This role is the first step to establish an Inhouse centre of excellence for Testing utilising a future mix of internal and external resource as required.
Main responsibilities:
To define and own the test strategy, test plans and data requirements for each applicable project.
Develop measures for Test efficiency, assess Testing maturity level, determine where it needs to go.
To work with Group IT colleagues and business representatives to ensure that suitable test environments are designed, delivered and managed to allow full testing to be completed.
To seek opportunities to increase the efficiency of the testing, including adoption of AI and test automation tools
To ensure that the testing strategy is kept up to date in the light of industry trends and changing business needs.
To manage and undertake test activities, including the allocation of test resources across multiple streams of IT projects
To develop estimates for test effort required to support projects.

Skills and Experience
Knowledge of structured testing methodologies and techniques for a broad range of IT solutions and applications.
Experienced in the use of advanced testing tools and techniques.
Knowledge of AWS Dev Ops environment
Willingness to still get your hands dirty from time-to-time undertaking testing.
Coordinating people and teams – ability to build strong working relationships with business teams and fellow IT leaders.
Executing effective leadership.
Negotiating and Influencing skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication.

Company Description
Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.
When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.
Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.

Job Description
What an Engineering Team Lead does at Visa:
Using your experience of building and coaching highly effective and empowered teams you will work with Product Managers, Practice Leads and other Engineering Management to deliver the best outcomes for our business and customers.
With your people leadership experience, you will be coaching and facilitating a career path for your team encouraging a culture of continuous learning and improvement. You will be responsible for building a highly engaged team who is connected to the products and services they deliver.
 What you will need:
Strong understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle
Experience in leading, coaching and mentoring people and progressing their careers
Strong communication and collaboration skills with the ability to adapt to the situation and audience
Demonstrable experience of delivering best in class software products and services in a commercial environment
Ability to rally people around a cause bringing clarity and direction to achieve positive outcomes
What will also help:
Demonstrable understanding of agile methodologies including Scrum, Kanban, XP, Lean etc
Experience in Delivery and Engineering Excellence including CI/CD, Dev Ops, Test Automation etc
Understanding and experience in cloud technologies and platforms (AWS, Azure etc)
Why this is important to Visa
You will be part of a team who are growing the capabilities and services in the Visa Spend Clarity to deliver scalable and robust solutions that will take Visa Spend Clarity to more customers and users around the globe.
Visa Spend Clarity is a key focus area with large growth ambitions driven by customer needs and a desire to innovate using modern cloud technologies. Operating with high autonomy this role is accountable for their stream of work to ensure we meet our customer and technical goals.
As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. job_title: Senior Analytics & Insight Specialist – Customer Outcomes
listing_jobDesc:
If you're going to join a bank, make it the local bank that cares about Kiwi.

At Kiwibank, we're on a journey to better off. We have a huge agenda, big ideas and a lot to work to start the year off with. It's going to be super rewarding and we'll have a lot of fun along the way.

What's this role about? He aha te ia o tēnei mahi?

Kiwibank is on a mission to become customers' first choice in Aotearoa. For Kiwibank to deliver on our promise of Making Kiwi Better Off, we have to deliver great products and services and put customers at the heart of what we do.

Reporting to the Customer Outcomes Lead, this role is all about collaboratively leading and delivering analytical and insights driven outcomes that enable Kiwibank to build trust with customers, ensuring that our products and services deliver what we promise and making it right when they don't.

As a senior member of the team you'll work collaboratively with stakeholders across the bank to develop and maintain data assets that provide meaningful insights that ensure Kiwibank is delivering on our good customer outcomes principles of make sure it works, keep the customer informed and make it right when things go wrong.

What are we looking for? Tā mātou e kimi nei?

You will be able to demonstrate an ability in leading analytical projects end to end, living and breathing all things data through effective modelling and analysis to enable Kiwibank to ensure we are delivering good customer outcomes. Ideally you will have some previous experience from a banking analytics environment although this is advantageous and is not a must.

This will ideally come from your experience using a range of analytic systems and techniques to identify opportunities to address business problems, eg. SQL, Cloud Analytics / Snowflake, Dev ops to name a few however you don't have to tick every box here. What's important is you know how to collect, manage and use data to solve business and customer problems.

You will be known for how you engage and partner with stakeholders and your collaborative approach across the business with your critical thinking and strong problem solving.

This role is perfect for someone who wants to work in a role that they know results in Kiwi being better off as a direct result of the work that they do as you will always need to have the customer front of mind and heart.

Ngā painga mōu - What's in it for you?

When you join us at Kiwibank, you'll be given the support you need to succeed. Our work environment is safe, accessible, and representative of our customers and communities. We're proud to have the rainbow tick, we are a certified B corporation, and we were the first bank in NZ to get the gender tick. We're also an accredited Living Wage employer.

Our great range of benefits include health and life cover, discounted banking and insurance products and an incredible package for new parents. We want you to get the most out of work and life, so you'll have the option to explore flexible working arrangements that suit both your needs and ours. And we now also offer one wellbeing day a quarter to ensure our people are taken care of.

At Kiwibank we're all about making Kiwi better off

As the largest homegrown (and owned) bank in Aotearoa, we strive to create an inclusive culture where everyone - our kiritaki (customers), hapori (communities) and kaimahi (staff) have the opportunity to thrive.

Our culture underpins how we are stronger together, allowing everyone to have a voice, rise to the challenge and make a difference for our customers. This shapes and influences the way we make decisions, how we interact with each other, and ultimately, our drive to get things done.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer - Testing Chapter - Build and Run my Business Platform
listing_jobDesc:
Senior Test Engineer in Build and Run my Business Tribe
Help build, support and maintain Trade Banking integration services
Flexible working options, development opportunities and banking benefits!
At ASB, we're all about doing what we can to help our customers get "One Step Ahead" by giving them the tools they need to manage their lives and plans for their families and future. Our products don't just serve ads or stream movies - they underpin our economy and touch people's lives.
If you've always wanted to apply your skills to a large-scale Kiwi success story, then today is your lucky day - as we are on the lookout for a Senior Test Engineer to join us in our BRMB Tribe.
About the role:
The Build and Run my Business Tribe is backing our frontline by building products to make banking simpler and easier for our people. We know we can do this by supporting and maintaining the core systems we use today, while building intuitive and effective solutions that will allow us to help our customers into the future.
Within BRMB we have our Trade Banking squad that support the services used by our International Trade service business to support all our importer and/or exporter customers. As a Senior Test Engineer you will apply your .Net test automation expertise to help the team in building, supporting and maintaining our .NetCore based Trade Banking integration services, which are key to the operation of the SaaS based Trade Banking platform.
You'll have the opportunity to get hands-on with some interesting and complex pieces of work that integrate on an enterprise scale, all while being part of a smaller squad that makes their own decisions about how to work through prioritisation - so your voice will be heard, and your opinions valued.
We advocate agile, fully cross functional teams which will take you through all facets of engineering in any given day. We are looking for a mix of technical skills to support the following activities:
Building out and supporting enhancements for our .NetCore based Trade Banking integration services platform.
Maintenance of the systems our services run on including Windows Servers, MS SQL and MQ services
Supporting activities associated with the upgrade of the SaaS platform.
About you:
We are looking for an individual that will take ownership for the testing of our technical solutions, drive continuous change for the squad and customers to ensure we are delivering best possible outcomes. You will work collaboratively with our squads and stakeholders to be the voice of engineering and deliver products that delight our customers.
We are looking for someone who has:
.NetCore test automation experience, preferably in an enterprise environment.
API Test automation experience.
Your proven initiative, problem solving abilities and technical leadership will make you well suited to this role.
Working knowledge of SQL and relational databases.
Ability to undertake additional manual testing, around 20%, and report quality status to stakeholders.
In addition, the following would be an advantage:
Certified in ISTQB Fundamentals
Worked in supporting financial services systems.
Performance Testing experience with tools such as jMeter, K6.
Exposure to Azure Dev Ops CI/CD
Working at ASB:
ASB's sense of who we are and what we stand for is grounded in our values. They guide our business in our day-to-day interactions with our team, customers, and community. They are what makes ASB - ASB.
Along with our interactions, values guide our actions and conduct, making ASB a safe and inclusive environment for both our people and our customers. They show that we care, are passionate and courageous, and that we act with integrity. Most importantly they unite us - because they are ASB.
We offer a flexible and supportive work environment and offer an open and inclusive culture; a place where we welcome and value your individuality, ideas, and goals.
If we've nailed our pitch and this role sounds like it might be the one for you then please click "apply"… we'd love to hear from you!
To be considered, all applications need to be via our on-line career channels and will be treated with confidentiality. Applications close 11pm on August 21st. Applications will be reviewed prior to this date.

Te Whiwhinga mahi | The opportunity

Auckland Transport is recognised globally as being on the forefront of emerging technology solutions. We apply innovative technology solutions to a variety of different channels of transportation, as we are passionate about making Auckland a truly liveable and sustainable city!

Our GIS Team is leading the way when it comes to innovative spatial solutions for Auckland Transport and its partners. We are utilising GIS Technology with real time data to create live mapping of public transport against timetables and schedules to provide better services to Auckland City and we are having fun doing this!

We have an awesome opportunity for a GIS Software Engineer to join our team! A day in the life of a GIS Software Engineer looks like:

Research, review and analyse the effectiveness and efficiency of existing solutions and develop strategies for enhancing, optimising, improving or further leveraging them.
Design, architecture and development of custom widget functionality within the GIS software application suite, including integration between enterprise systems, developing models and front-end functionalities of new and existing applications.
Conduct thorough testing (unit and integration testing) to ensure business outcomes are achieved, utilising automated workflows and industry best practice.
Support and enhance enterprise systems through developing automation pipelines for AI (artificial intelligence) and machine learning.
Create detailed new technical descriptions and documentation of solutions and edit/review existing relevant documentation for use and support of operations and management.

Ko koe tēnei | About you

To succeed as a GIS Software Engineer you will require:

A tertiary degree (Bachelor's Degree or higher) qualification in Information Sciences or Geoinformation systems with relevant software engineering experience.
2-3 years' experience in a similar role performing high quality customisation and automation tasks using development toolkits.
Development experience in the practical use and application of ESRI's ArcGIS suite of products including desktop, server, web applications and widgets and the use of third-party plugins and extensions.
Sound knowledge of core programming languages Python, .Net (C# or VB), JavaScript and HTML5/CSS and SQL programming and use of stored procedure protocol and SQL spatial views.
Knowledge of cloud technologies such as AWS or MS AZURE, desirable
Development experience using Agile method (Software Development Lifecycle), preferrably with Azure Dev Ops.
Basic ETL experience with FME Desktop.

Agile practitioner who has led complex technical projects
Understanding of industry market conditions and trends
Support teams in problem identification and decision-making

Kea is a transformation hub, accelerating AT's delivery quality at pace, making AT a more adaptive organisation.
Working adaptively means delivering value through empowered teams, working closely with customers and stakeholders, using proven and well-established practices and frameworks including agile, lean and human centred design.
Paired with a growth mindset, these practices, tools and frameworks allow AT to adapt and respond to problems, environment and market changes, and deliver consistently.
Kea's key outcomes:
building capability
supporting a constructive culture,
creating better customer outcomes,
increasing delivery pace and
optimising cost/ revenue
AT's business plan tackles challenges that affect us all, such as sustainability and city growth, while creating easy journeys for our communities. We are an organisation full of solutions and experts. Our challenge is optimising the passion and excellence across the organisation to improve outcomes for Aucklanders.
Te Whiwhinga mahi | The opportunity
AT's Adaptive Practice is not an "out of the box" approach. This means you have a unique opportunity to advocate and build a tailored approach to support the organisation and its partners.
This role plays a pivotal part supporting a better cross-functional, trusting and empowered team culture
This role works across the organisation, with partners and external stakeholders on AT's business plan priorities
The role champions adaptive ways of working; growing and supporting communities of practice across AT. These include agile practices, delivery coaching and product ownership; and tools such as Miro and Azure Dev Ops.
Ko koe tēnei | About you
The adaptive coach helps teams live and breathe the Kea principles: Collaborative, Empowered, Adaptive and Impactful.
This person will have experience in adaptive methodologies, tools and practices and be comfortable with customising the approach to each new workstream according to their needs.

The Role
Here at Fisher & Paykel Appliances, we design with people in mind and the lives lived around our products. We aim to create moments of delight together in the heart of the home, sustainably enhancing the quality of people's lives, now and for future generations.
Working at Fisher & Paykel Appliances, you will feel empowered and be able to take the work and make it your own. As a team, we take a collaborative approach to design, we have a culture where our ideas are heard, and we can see these ideas flourish.
This is where you come in
We’re on the lookout for a Software Engineer to join our team in Dunedin. This team works closely with our design engineers to create the software for the next generation of cooking appliances.
Responsibilities
In this role you will need to:
Collaboratively define, scope, prioritize, and estimate work
Develop product software as part of an Agile team
Deliver features with quality and supportability
Triage, reproduce, and debug issues reported by other stakeholders for our areas of responsibility
Drive helpful conversations around technical issues and engineering practices, suggesting improvements and ideas as you see them
Give and receive feedback to grow yourself and the team
Write clear requirements, documentation and test cases.
Process & Technologies
At Fisher & Paykel Appliances:
Software is developed using Agile processes
Functionality is implemented in C, Python, C# and Qt
The development platforms used are Bare Metal, Linux and Android
Atlassian tools are used for source control, issue management and planning
Azure Dev Ops are used for test case management and continuous integration
Qualifications and experience
You should have:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related degree.
3+ years relevant working experience.
What we offer
A collaborative team-based culture, a challenging and supportive work environment, career development and an opportunity to work with leading technology. Also on offer is a competitive salary, superannuation scheme, as well as relocation and immigration assistance, just a few of the benefits on offer.
Contact us now to find out more about this exciting opportunity and join our challenging but supportive work environment, and the chance to be a part of a team developing the world's next generation of appliances and technology.
